result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Ryan Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying a Concealed Knife, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter.
The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Ryan Butler

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey Ryan Butler
Current: 2672 26 3/4 Ave, Mikana, WI 54857 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: 2672 Main St, Mikana, WI 54857 United States
Notice of Completion
JOC returned

3:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey Ryan Butler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jeffrey Ryan Butler. Def appears by video from Barron County jail.  Def waives all in-person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollack: def pleading G to amended Ct 2 (without the repeat enhancer), DRI Ct 1, joint rec for court costs.  State moves to amend to remove repeater; Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 2 and orders a JOC; Count 1 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  Court takes judicial notice of Barron County Case.  Court orders  $500 costs and fines- to be taken in full from cash bond posted.  Appeal rights provided.  Fingerprints and DNA to be provided to the Sheriff (unless they've already been provided).
Defendant's Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

01:45 PM Defendant, Jeffrey Ryan Butler, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak making special appearance.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for return on warrant/ initial appearance.  Warrant is quashed.  Def likely qualifies for PD.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  NG to misdemeanor counts.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  State asks for standard signature bond.  No objection by def.  Court orders $500 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
